testCases.explanation: The cell at (1,1) has value 1 and its nearest 0 is 1 step away. All 0 cells have distance 0.
The cell at (2,1) is distance 2 from the nearest 0 (via (1,1) to (0,1) or (1,0) or (1,2)). Cells (2,0) and (2,2) are distance 1 from the 0s in row 1.
Single cell with value 0: distance is 0.
Cell (0,0) has value 1 and its nearest 0 is at (0,1), distance 1. Cell (0,1) is 0 with distance 0.
BFS from both 0 cells at (0,0) and (2,2) simultaneously. Each cell gets its minimum distance to either 0.

description: Given an m x n binary matrix mat, return the distance of the nearest 0 for each cell. The distance between two adjacent cells is 1.
constraints: There is at least one 0 in mat
